lines.text: [Jack Benny then woke up, from his dream]
Gee, what a crazy dream. Imagine, Mary and me, as two little mice, trapped inside a cat. And I was playing the violin.

[after waking up, he hears a bad violin rendition of Rock-A-Bye Baby, that came from inside his sleeping cat. Then, he sees the same two figures of mice, of Jack Benny and Mary Livingstone, that were in his dream, as they were crawling out, escaping from his sleeping cat. Benny then turned to the audience, with one of his most-popular trademark takes, as the cartoon concluded and closing credits begin]
But boss, I rented it from you for a week for five bucks.
The week was up five minutes ago. Now bring it here.
It's Miss Livingston's birthday, and I'm taking her out.
[Jack puts on the jacket and a blue bow tie]
Mmm mmm! What that tie does for those baby blue eyes.

[Looking in a mirror]
They are nice, aren't they?
Oh, hello, Mr. Benny. How are things on the outside? We win the war yet?
Oh, uh... yes. Yes, we did.
That's good. What do you think they'll do with the Kaiser?
And thought you taw a puddy tat...
There's just one thing to do for that...
Don, you're not supposed to do a commercial. This is a movie, and...
A movie? Gosh, I've always wanted to be a movie actor. Ahem! What light in yon window breaks? It is the dawn...
Oh, gee whiz! You never let me do anything I want to!
Down in the cheese vault, counting out his cheese.
I just love cheese. Really I do.
